column1: In women, this exam may be done at the same time as a pelvic exam.

It may be done: - As part of a routine yearly physical exam in both men and women - When your healthcare provider suspects you are bleeding somewhere in your digestive tract - When men are having symptoms that suggest the prostate is enlarged In men, the test can be used to check the size of the prostate and to look for abnormal bumps or other changes of the prostate gland.
